intro: Caryomene, commonly known as the "sweet pepper tree," is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its ornamental, spiny leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Caryomene thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it both a decorative and culinary plant in its native regions.
